member.name: T:ADMS.API.Common.DocumentActivityValidationHelper
member.summary: Provides comprehensive helper methods and constants for validating document activity types within the ADMS system.
member.remarks:
This static helper class provides robust document activity validation functionality for the ADMS legal document management system, supporting DocumentActivityDto and DocumentActivityMinimalDto validation. The validation methods ensure data integrity, business rule compliance, and consistent validation logic across the application.
Key Features:
Activity name validation against predefined allowed activities from database seed data
GUID validation for activity IDs with proper empty value checking
Length validation consistent with database constraints (StringLength(50))
Case-insensitive validation with normalization support
High-performance validation using frozen collections for O(1) lookup performance
Thread-safe operations optimized for concurrent access scenarios
Integration with standard .NET validation infrastructure
Document Activity Categories:
Lifecycle Operations: CREATED, DELETED, RESTORED, SAVED
Check-in/Check-out Operations: CHECKED IN, CHECKED OUT
Validation Process:
Validates activity name format and length constraints
Normalizes activity names to uppercase with trimming
Validates against approved activity list from database seed data
Performs GUID validation for activity identifiers
Returns detailed validation results for comprehensive error reporting
The helper follows established ADMS validation patterns and integrates seamlessly with the existing validation infrastructure, including centralized validation services and standardized error reporting mechanisms.
Database Integration: The allowed activities list is synchronized with the DocumentActivity seed data in AdmsContext.cs, ensuring consistency between validation logic and database constraints.
Thread Safety: All methods in this class are thread-safe and use immutable frozen collections for optimal performance in concurrent scenarios without external synchronization.
Performance Considerations: Uses FrozenSet for O(1) average lookup performance and minimal memory allocation. All validation operations are optimized for high-frequency usage in API scenarios.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified username is allowed according to ADMS business rules.
member.param: The username to validate. Can be null or whitespace.
member.returns: true if the name is allowed; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
A valid username must meet all the following criteria:
Not be null or whitespace
Be between {MinUserNameLength} and {MaxUserNameLength} characters long (matching database constraint)
Not be a reserved system name (case-insensitive check)
Contain only valid characters (letters, numbers, spaces, periods, hyphens, underscores)
Not start or end with special characters (must start/end with letter or number)
Not contain consecutive special characters
Not contain multiple consecutive spaces
Performance: Uses FrozenSet for O(1) average lookup performance on reserved names check.
